name: Cell Phone Stand with Wireless Bluetooth Speaker and Anti-Slip Base HD Surround Sound Perfect for Home and Outdoors with Bluetooth Speaker for Desk Compatible with iPhone/ipad/Samsung Galaxy
about_this_item: 2 in 1 Bluetooth Speaker + Phone Stand:Jteman cell phone stand with bluetooth speaker gadget gift, the phone stand allows you to free your hands,the bluetooth speaker makes your phone sound louder and clearer,The built-in microphone speaker can help the hearing-impaired elderly hear the sound more clearly.This cool gadgets makes a practical birthday gifts for men and women

Widely Compatible:Jteman bluetooth speaker with phone holder is suitable for most 4-13 inch smartphones,tablets and e-readers with bluetooth function.The hook fits devices up to 0.59 inches (15 mm) thick. NOTE:This product does not have a power bank function and cannot charge your phone

Adjustable Angle,Foldable Stand:Multiple angles can be adjusted to meet your different viewing needs.Let you enjoy music, watch videos and Facetime easily. Foldable stand design,easy to carry and save space.Jteman phone stand speaker for desk is a useful gadgets

Stable and Anti-slip:Jteman 2 in 1 Bluetooth Speaker with Stand is a practical gift.The hook is stable and reliable, and the cushion back and bottom of the phone holder are fully covered with anti-slip silicone,which can provide maximum protection for your device and prevent any scratches and sliding

Christmas Gifts for Men and Women:The foldable Bluetooth speaker phone holder is simple and easy to use, making it an ideal gifts for men and women.It is also suitable as a kitchen gadgets,Christmas gifts,birthday gifts, white elephant gifts for adult,mothers day gifts,fathers day gifts,Valentine's Day,mens gifts,and various anniversary gifts for him

title: Big Sound Great Connection!
content: I definitely do my research before I buy, so I was impressed with not only the sound for the size but how easily it connects to my Bluetooth each time I turn it on!  I tried to use it as a speaker phone during a call, but I just couldn’t get it to work- but that’s not the reason I bought it in the first place.  I wanted more sound than just my phone, and the ability to take it outside or use it when I was getting ready. Impressed especially for the price!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is a really nice cell phone stand and speaker combo! I've used a few in the past with sound quality issues, but this one is fantastic. It's easily rechargeable, and just a bit bigger than a typical power bank, making it easy to store and travel with. The top piece simply folds up with a little flip tab to rest your phone on and angle as needed, and it has additional rubberized pads to keep everything secure. It takes just five seconds to set up and turn on, giving you a nice bluetooth connected mini entertainment station! The buttons are also convenient, featuring skip, back, pause, and volume controls, as well as call answering and ending functionalities. The sound quality is very impressive, it even sounds like you're listening to a television if you aren't looking right at it. All in all, I'm super impressed with this and would definitely recommend it!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2024

title: Very Impressed with the Sound Quality and Connection! Great for Travel!
content: I am very pleased with this speaker/phone stand. I had to return the first unit I received because it was defective but the support rep was willing to replace the unit quickly and they did. The Bluetooth light was not coming on without the speaker being plugged in even though it was fully charged. I am appreciative of the help and fast response and the product suits my needs and is easy to use. It's affirdable and it sounds great too.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I got this speaker because I’ve been listening to a lot of audiobooks, and at the highest volume on my phone, it was still just too quiet. This speaker was a nice addition to being able to have a phone holder and a speaker in one. It’s been nice because the volume is a nice increase. I do not have to have my phone at the full for me to hear it. It runs completely at the phone’s volume. No volume of its own like other speakers, so when you turn the speaker, vs on the phone. It’s the same functioning. It was a bit of a disappointment for me at first. But then, I realized JUST how loud the speakers are, and I’m to keep it at halfway and feel like it’s louder than before the speaker with the volume all the way up.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024

title: Very Nice
content: Now where the problem lies. It has been skipping my audiobooks. I have reset everything so many times, and had no better luck from anything. I cannot figure out why it’s happening. Why it continues to happen. Worst yet, why it seems to happen more so with males than females. Though it WILL happen with females if that have a deep enough voice that they are using. Or I should say where they’re registering a “suspenseful presence.” I know that it’s the speaker vs a complication with the app or my phone because after getting frustrated from spending at least ten minutes on this problem. I undid the bluetooth, and just played it by my speaker so I could hear this characters part. I had to go back to the beginning of this part because I hadn’t realized just HOW MUCH I’d missed. They can be subtle skips where it’s a word, and it doesn’t sound THAT off. But once you HEAR the difference. WOW! So that can suck that that’s happening. I’m not sure WHY that’s happening. And honestly, for this reason alone, I would give the quality of the sound maybe three stars. Because while it IS loud, it does manage to skip sounds for whatever reason.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: And while others could argue that it’s a cheap speaker and that “you get what you pay for.” I had a “big name” brand speaker previous to this one that I’d used maybe a total of five months, owned it for a few years. But one day, it just stopped charging. When I talked to the company, they said that the charging port was probably loose or dirty. It had a cover, I kept it on it. So that couldn’t have been the correct thing, but I cleaned it all the same. I was offered a measly discount to get a new one, but why? So I could have it crap out on me again as soon as the warranty was over? It doesn’t matter the price you pay. I’ve had off brand, “low quality” items and had them outlast ALL my big name brands, and vice versa. I think a big thing is it comes down to how you care for your materials. I myself, I can be hard on my stuff. Not intentionally, but I can be clumsy. So as often as possible, I’ll buy bumper cases. I try to add to the protection of what I have because I know that I cannot always have the best spacial awareness. Worst than that I have two young boys who make my house an active war zone of destruction and chaos where nothing is safe for long. So lately, when I am buying, I opt for a lower cost, but try to get a better quality. As it is possible. And then I do what I can to maintain the quality for as long as I can. I feel like this is the spot of this speaker. No, it’s not a JBL or Bose. And that’s ok. It’s a “cheap” speaker, but it has a lot of good qualities to it. In spite of the fact that it’s skipping in the audiobook area.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2024

title: It does an adequate job
content: Some of the ways that the speaker does reign so high is that it has the “grippers” on the back and fold out bottom. That actually works at holding my phone in place, so long as I do nothing to upset the table or walk around with it where it will tip out. Although I HAVE walked around with it, and it’s kept an impressive amount of balance in its place. The holding part folds away, and it goes down relatively flat so you can store it away for travel. The part that holds the phone moves up and down and at an forward angel which has come in handy when I needed to do something on my phone, but didn’t want to have to pick it up to do it. I love that I can take this speaker, and speaker alone, and go to the farthest parts of my house with it. Leaving my phone behind and still getting the same quality in sound as when the phone was right next to it. I’ve had bluetooth devices that they have to stay in tandem together or loose the connection, loose the sound, or whatever. So the fact that I can leave my phone behind, and JUST take the speaker while I grab food in the kitchen. Leaving me one less thing to carry back with me is so nice. I HATE earbuds. HATE the feeling of things in and on my ears. So this is a perfect alternative, and it’s provided me so much entertainment of the weeks that I’ve had it. I don’t regret getting this speaker/ phone holder at all.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I love that when I have had it off, and turn it back on, the speaker automatically connects back to my phone. Making the audiobook appear on my Lock Screen. No having to hunt for it, or unlocking my phone to get it. It’s a quick and easy transition back to my story, which I appreciate. My expensive speaker I’d always have to resync it to the phone, and then I’d have to reopen where I was getting the audio from. It was a lot of trying steps just to enjoy what I wanted. Now it’s all so streamlined for my enjoyment.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2024

title: Splendid sound and even better value
content: So it comes down to recommendations? Would I or wouldn’t I? I would! I would gift this to someone. I would tell ANYONE about this. It’s why I’m choosing to write a review about it. I’m a little flummoxed about the skipping audio. But again, it’s something that could have happened on any number of devices at any number of cost ranges. It could be happening for any number of reason. But I think that this is an outstanding speaker that has been amazing for me. Probably one of my better ones I’ve own. Not that I’ve owned a lot. But unlike the Alexa’s that have to remain plugged in at all times, this one allows for freedom, and the JBL’s that are “surround sound,” but then get a “loose charging port” easily. This is just a low expectations speaker. Even IF I “get what you pay for.” Then, I’ve gotten what I’ve paid for in comparison.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024

title: Speaker plus cell phone holder
content: The first one I ordered was defective and would not charge up. Because the Bluetooth phone stand did cost very much  I decided not to box it up and drive it to a UPS store for a refund, but I did initially give it a bad review. The seller reached out to me and offered to replace it at no charge and with me having to go through the hassle of returning the defective one. I gave the seller my shipping address and had a new one a couple of days later. The new one works great. It's a good little portable speaker. I like that I can have music or a pod cast on in the kitchen while I am cooking and I  can hear it over the kitchen noises. It's also great if you like to soak in the tub like I do, but don't want to risk dropping your phone in the tub. I can turn on my Amazon music Playlist and not have to put my phone on the edge of the tub to hear it.

title: Verified Purchase
content: This was one of my favorite purchases, mostly because of how well it works and the value for the price.  I purchased it for my husband because he loves watching YouTube and anime on his phone.  He was so happy I got this for him so he doesn’t have to hold up his phone, especially when he falls asleep watching lol.  He puts his phone on the stand and then puts the speaker right on his belly to watch haha.  It connects easily via Bluetooth and you can adjust the volume either with the phone buttons or with the buttons on the speaker itself.  It gets pretty loud, we’ve actually huddled around his phone to watch a movie together, love this!  We had it for a while and he uses it pretty frequently.  It’s easy to charge and haven’t had any issues with it.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023

I did not notice the same issue on calls but to be honest, the call quality wasn't of utmost importance to me. Also found it cumbersome to have to plug in my phone separately - would be better if the the stand had a cable dock so that you could charge and listen conveniently.
